name: Leaf Spot
info: Leaf Spot is a common fungal or bacterial disease that causes spots on plant leaves.
symptoms: Small brown, black, or yellow spots on leaves
Spots may merge and kill larger leaf areas
treatment: Remove affected leaves, improve air circulation, and apply a fungicide.
organic_control: Apply neem oil or compost tea sprays.
spread_method: Spread through splashing water, wind, and contaminated tools.

name: Blight
info: Blight is a fast-spreading disease that causes browning and death of plant tissues.
symptoms: Sudden browning or blackening of foliage
treatment: Use resistant varieties, prune infected parts, and apply copper-based fungicides.
chemical_control: Spray with mancozeb or copper fungicides.
organic_control: Use baking soda solution or compost tea.
spread_method: Spreads rapidly in wet, humid conditions through rain splash and wind.

name: Powdery Mildew
info: Powdery Mildew is a fungal disease that appears as a white powder on plant surfaces.
symptoms: White or gray powdery spots on leaves and stems
treatment: Apply sulfur-based fungicides and increase airflow around plants.
chemical_control: Use sulfur or potassium bicarbonate sprays.
organic_control: Apply milk spray (1:10 ratio) or neem oil.
spread_method: Spreads via wind-blown spores, especially in dry, warm climates.
prevention: Remove and destroy infected plant parts

name: Rust
info: Rust is a fungal disease that produces rust-colored spores on the underside of leaves.
treatment: Remove infected leaves, avoid overhead watering, and use fungicides.
organic_control: Use sulfur dust or garlic extract spray.
spread_method: Spreads through wind, water, and contaminated plant debris.
